input_data:
# Korean Cryptographic Module Configuration
# /etc/kisa/crypto_policy.conf
# Korea Information Security Agency (KISA) Approved Algorithms

[GENERAL]
version=2.1
standard=KCMVP
last_updated=2024-09-17
quantum_transition_status=planning

[SYMMETRIC_CIPHERS]
# Korean domestic algorithms (GROVER vulnerable)
default_cipher=SEED-128-CBC
backup_cipher=ARIA-256-GCM
lightweight_cipher=HIGHT-128-CTR
modern_cipher=LEA-256-GCM

# International algorithms for interoperability
interop_cipher_1=AES-256-GCM
interop_cipher_2=ChaCha20-Poly1305

# Deprecated but still supported
legacy_cipher_1=SEED-128-ECB  # ECB mode vulnerable
legacy_cipher_2=ARIA-128-CBC
legacy_cipher_3=DES-EDE3-CBC  # 3DES for legacy systems

[HASH_FUNCTIONS]
# Korean hash functions
primary_hash=LSH-256
secondary_hash=LSH-512
legacy_hash=HAS-160  # Quantum vulnerable

# International hash functions
interop_hash_1=SHA-256
interop_hash_2=SHA-384
interop_hash_3=SHA-512

# Deprecated hash functions
deprecated_hash_1=MD5      # Critically vulnerable
deprecated_hash_2=SHA-1    # Collision attacks
deprecated_hash_3=HAS-160  # Quantum vulnerable

[ASYMMETRIC_CRYPTOGRAPHY]
# Korean digital signature algorithms
digital_signature=KCDSA-256
elliptic_curve_signature=EC-KCDSA-256

# Key exchange (all quantum vulnerable)
key_exchange_1=ECDH-secp256r1
key_exchange_2=RSA-2048
key_exchange_3=DH-2048

# Certificate algorithms
cert_signature_alg=RSA-SHA256
alt_cert_signature=ECDSA-secp256r1

[KEY_DERIVATION]
kdf_algorithm=PBKDF2-LSH256
kdf_iterations=100000
salt_length=32

# Legacy KDF (vulnerable)
legacy_kdf_1=PBKDF1-MD5
legacy_kdf_2=PBKDF1-SHA1

[RANDOM_NUMBER_GENERATION]
prng_algorithm=DRBG-LSH256
seed_source=/dev/urandom
entropy_threshold=256

# Hardware security module
hsm_enabled=true
hsm_model=KISA-HSM-v3
hsm_algorithms=SEED,ARIA,HIGHT,LEA,LSH,KCDSA

[PROTOCOL_SETTINGS]
# TLS/SSL configuration
tls_min_version=1.2
tls_max_version=1.3
preferred_curves=secp256r1,secp384r1,brainpoolP256r1

# Korean cipher suites preference
cipher_suite_1=TLS_ARIA_256_GCM_SHA384
cipher_suite_2=TLS_SEED_128_GCM_SHA256
cipher_suite_3=TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384

[MIGRATION_PLAN]
# Post-quantum cryptography transition
pqc_readiness=research_phase
pqc_target_date=2030-01-01
pqc_pilot_algorithms=Kyber,Dilithium,SPHINCS+

# Legacy algorithm deprecation timeline
deprecate_md5=2024-12-31
deprecate_sha1=2025-06-30
deprecate_rsa_1024=2024-12-31
deprecate_rsa_2048=2028-12-31

[COMPLIANCE]
standards=KCMVP,FIPS140-2,Common_Criteria
audit_frequency=quarterly
last_audit=2024-06-15
next_audit=2024-09-15

# Vulnerability assessment
vuln_scan_enabled=true
quantum_threat_monitoring=enabled
last_vuln_scan=2024-09-10

[LOGGING]
log_level=INFO
log_file=/var/log/kisa/crypto_usage.log
audit_log=/var/log/kisa/crypto_audit.log

# Algorithm usage tracking
track_usage=true
usage_reporting=monthly
usage_log_format=JSON

[EMERGENCY_PROCEDURES]
# Quantum computer threat response
quantum_emergency_contact=qc-response@kisa.or.kr
emergency_disable_algorithms=RSA,ECDSA,DH,ECDH
emergency_fallback_algorithms=SEED-256,ARIA-256,LSH-512

# Algorithm compromise response
compromise_response_team=cert-response@kisa.or.kr
compromise_notification_time=4_hours
compromise_mitigation_time=24_hours
description: Korean KISA cryptographic policy configuration showing domestic algorithms (SEED, ARIA, HIGHT, LEA) alongside international standards
expected_analysis_points: Korean domestic algorithms (SEED, ARIA, HIGHT, LEA, KCDSA, EC-KCDSA, HAS-160, LSH)
cryptographic policy configurations and algorithm preferences
quantum transition planning and legacy algorithm deprecation
